children.text: ELD Goal 1.1: Listening Comprehension
Follow Oral Directions
Follow simple one-step oral directions.
Follow simple two-step oral directions.
Follow two-step oral directions.
Follow simple multi-step oral directions.
Follow multi-step oral directions.
Understand Social and Academic Conversations
Respond appropriately to brief, very simple social conversations on familiar topics with contextual support.
Demonstrate comprehension of brief, very simple social conversations on familiar topics with contextual support.
Demonstrate comprehension of brief, very simple social conversations and academic language on familiar topics with contextual support.
Demonstrate comprehension of simple social conversations on familiar topics with contextual support.
Respond appropriately to simple social conversations on mostly familiar topics with contextual support.
Demonstrate comprehension of simple social conversations on mostly familiar topics with contextual support.
Demonstrate comprehension of simple social conversations and academic language on mostly familiar topics with contextual support.
Demonstrate comprehension of simple social and academic conversations on familiar topics with contextual support.
Respond appropriately to social and simple classroom conversations on mostly familiar, concrete topics.
Demonstrate comprehension of social conversations and simple academic discussions on mostly familiar, concrete topics.
Demonstrate comprehension of social conversations and simple academic discussions on mostly familiar, concrete topics.
Draw conclusions from social conversations and simple academic discussions on mostly familiar, concrete topics.
Respond appropriately to classroom conversations on mostly concrete topics.
Demonstrate comprehension of academic discussions on mostly concrete topics.
Demonstrate comprehension of academic discussions on mostly concrete topics.
Draw conclusions from academic discussions on mostly concrete topics.
Respond appropriately to classroom conversations on concrete and abstract topics.
Demonstrate comprehension of academic discussions on concrete and abstract topics.
Demonstrate comprehension of academic discussions on concrete and abstract topics.
Draw conclusions from academic discussions on concrete and abstract topics.
Understand Key Ideas of Information Presented Orally
Identify a key idea of very brief, concrete information presented orally with visual support.
Identify a few key ideas of brief, mostly concrete information presented orally with visual support.
Identify a few key ideas of concrete and some abstract information presented orally with some visual support.
Identify key ideas of information presented orally.
Understand Main Idea of Information Presented Orally
Identify literal concepts in very brief, simple stories and information presented orally with visual support.
Identify literal concepts in very brief, simple information presented orally with visual support.
Identify literal concepts in simple information presented orally with visual support.
Identify the main idea and a few supporting details in brief, simple stories and information presented orally with visual support.
Identify the main idea and a few supporting details in brief, simple information presented orally with visual support.
Briefly describe the main idea and a few supporting details in simple information presented orally with visual support.
Briefly describe the main idea and some supporting details of information presented orally.
Briefly describe the main idea and some supporting details of information presented orally.
Evaluate the general coherence of information presented orally with visual support.
Describe the main idea and most supporting details of information presented orally near grade level.
Summarize the main idea and most supporting details of information presented orally near grade level.
Evaluate the general coherence and effectiveness of a speaker’s important points and some evidence.
Describe main ideas and supporting details of information presented orally at grade level.
Summarize main ideas and supporting details of information presented orally at grade level.
Evaluate the general coherence and effectiveness of a speaker's important points, evidence, and organization of ideas.
ELD Goal 2.1: Speaking Applications
Ask and Answer Questions
Ask and answer familiar, very simple questions using gestures or words.
Ask and answer very simple questions using words or phrases.
Ask very simple questions about a speaker's briefly stated opinion about a familiar topic.
Ask simple questions to clarify a speaker's briefly stated opinion about a basic, familiar topic.
Ask and answer simple questions using a few words.
Ask and answer simple questions using phrases or simple sentences.
Ask simple questions to determine a speaker's opinion about a familiar topic.
Ask simple questions to determine a speaker's point of view about a basic topic.
Ask and answer questions using phrases or simple sentences.
Ask and answer questions with some details and more complex sentences.
Ask questions to elicit information about a speaker's content to determine the speaker's position.
Ask questions to elicit information about a speaker's content and determine the speaker's point of view on the subject.
Ask and answer questions using detailed sentences with some errors.
Ask and answer questions using standard grammar with few errors.
Paraphrase a speaker's point of view and ask questions about the speaker's content and position.
Summarize a speaker's point of view and ask questions about the speaker's content and attitude toward the subject.
Ask and answer questions using detailed sentences with few errors.
Summarize a speaker's point of view and ask specific questions about the speaker's content and attitude toward the subject.
Communicate Information Orally
Express basic needs using gestures or words.
Express basic needs using simple words or phrases.
Express basic needs and state facts using phrases and simple sentences.
Express basic needs, feelings, and information on familiar topics using simple sentences.
Express basic needs and feelings using a few words.
Express basic needs and feelings using phrases and simple sentences.
Express needs and state facts using more detailed sentences.
Express needs, feelings, and information on some newly presented topics using more detailed sentences.
Share information orally using simple sentences.
Paraphrase information on familiar topics with support.
Briefly describe information on familiar topics presented orally with visual support.
Paraphrase oral information on new topics presented with visual support.
Respond orally to information shared by others using coherent sentences.
Summarize major ideas and supporting details.
Retell or paraphrase information that has been shared by others, using coherent sentences.
Retell Stories or Experiences
Respond to prompting about an experience or story using gestures and words.
Tell a brief experience or story in response to prompts using words and phrases.
Tell an experience or story in a logical sequence with some prompting, using phrases and simple sentences.
Tell an experience or story in a logical sequence using simple sentences without prompting.
Tell an experience or story in a logical sequence using detailed sentences without prompting.
Plan Oral Presentations
Complete a graphic organizer or label a series of illustrations on an experience or familiar story using words or phrases.
Complete a graphic organizer on a familiar topic that follows a logical sequence of events.
Complete a graphic organizer or an outline for simple narrative and informative presentations.
Organize simple oral presentations that maintain a clear focus.
Organize oral presentations that maintain a clear focus; use expanded word choice and sentence structure.
Organize Oral Presentations
Complete a graphic organizer or label a series of illustrations on an experience or familiar story using phrases or simple sentences.
Complete a graphic organizer or label a series of illustrations on an experience or familiar topic using simple sentences.
Complete a graphic organizer on a familiar topic that follows a logical sequence of events using sentence frames.
Complete a graphic organizer that introduces a familiar topic and includes a quotation or reference, using sentence frames.
Complete a graphic organizer or an outline for narrative and informative presentations using key sentence starters.
Organize simple oral presentations with an introduction and conclusion, including literary quotations or references to authoritative sources, using key sentence starters.
Organize oral presentations that maintain a clear focus.
Organize oral presentations with an introduction and conclusion, including literary quotations, anecdotes, and references to authoritative sources.
Organize oral presentations that maintain a clear focus and use expanded word choice and sentence structure.
Organize oral presentations with an introduction and conclusion, including literary quotations, anecdotes, and references to authoritative sources; use expanded word choice and sentence structure.
Deliver Oral Presentations
Retell experiences or familiar stories in response to prompts; use words, phrases, and props.
Retell experiences in response to prompts using phrases and simple sentences.
Retell experiences in response to prompts using simple sentences.
Deliver brief narrative oral presentations on a familiar topic in response to prompts; use simple sentences and props.
Deliver brief narrative or informative oral presentations on familiar topics in response to some prompts using expanded sentences.
Deliver brief narrative and informative oral presentations on familiar topics using some detailed sentences, with some prompting.
Deliver brief narrative oral presentations following a logical sequence and using expanded sentences.
Deliver brief narrative and informative oral presentations, maintaining a focus on a topic and using more detailed sentences.
Deliver brief narrative and expository presentations that maintain a focus on a sequence of events or thesis, including some significant points and detailed sentences.
Deliver narrative and informative oral presentations that maintain a focus on key events or ideas with some supporting details.
Deliver narrative and informative oral presentations that maintain a focus on main ideas and significant details.
Deliver narrative and expository presentations that maintain a focus on a sequence of events or thesis, and include information on significant points.
Deliver narrative and informative oral presentations that maintain a clear focus on important events or ideas with supporting details.

Deliver informative and persuasive oral presentations that maintain a focus on main ideas and significant details, engage the interests of the audience, and quote from sources when summarizing articles.

Deliver narrative presentations that narrate a sequence of events and communicate their significance; deliver expository presentations that state a thesis, and include information on different perspectives.
ELD Goal 3.1: Reading Process
Use Text Features to Locate Information
Identify cover and title of a book; hold book right side up and turn pages in the correct direction.
Identify letters of the alphabet, words, numerals, and parts of a book (e.g., cover, title).
Identify words, sentences, and parts of a book (e.g., cover, title).
Identify basic text features (e.g., end-sentence punctuation, headings) in familiar print formats.
Use the title and illustrations to aid comprehension of information in a book or reading selection.
Use basic text features (e.g., bold print, paragraphing) to locate information in familiar print formats.
Use grade-level text features to locate information in a book or reading selection. [N/A for K]
Use text features to locate information in familiar and some unfamiliar print formats at grade level.
Use text features to locate information in various print formats at grade level.
Use Text Features to Understand Information
Identify a few basic text features (e.g., title, author, headings, illustrations) in informational text.
Identify basic text features in informational text.
Use a few basic text features in informational texts to locate a few key points.
Use basic text features in informational texts to locate a few key points.
Use text features and basic organizational structures in informational text at independent reading level to locate and describe key points.
Use text features and basic organizational structures in informational text at independent reading level to locate and describe key points.
Use text features and organizational structures in informational text near grade level to locate and describe key points.
Analyze text features and organizational structures in informational text at grade level to locate and explain key points.
Use text features and organizational structures in informational text at grade level to locate and explain key points.
Use Graphic Features to Support Understanding of Text
Identify information from pictures and symbols in signs.
Use familiar graphic features (e.g., illustrations, charts) to support understanding of written words and phrases.
Identify a few familiar graphic features (e.g., diagrams, maps) in informational text at independent reading level.
Identify familiar graphic features (e.g., diagrams, maps) in informational text at independent reading level.
Identify information in familiar, simple bar graphs or diagrams.
Use familiar graphic features (e.g., diagrams, maps) to support understanding of brief, simple text.
Use a few familiar graphic features in informational text at independent reading level to locate a few key points.
Use familiar graphic features in informational text at independent reading level to locate a few key points.
Identify information in simple graphs, charts, and diagrams. [N/A for K]
Use familiar graphic features to find information and support understanding of text at independent reading level.
Use graphic features in informational text at independent reading level to describe key points.
Describe information in simple graphs, charts, and diagrams. [N/A for K]
Use familiar and some newly learned graphic features to find information and support understanding of most grade-level text.
Interpret graphic features of text near grade level.
Use information from simple graphs, charts, and diagrams. [N/A for K]
Use various graphic features to find information and support understanding of grade-level text.
Interpret graphic features of text at grade level.
Decode Words Using Phonological Awareness Skills
Name some upper and lowercase letters.
Identify first, middle, and last sounds in a single-syllable word.
Identify first, middle, and last sounds in a single-syllable word; match vowel and consonant sounds to all letters.
Name upper and lowercase letters; match vowel and consonant sounds to some letters.
Match vowel and consonant sounds to all letters.
Use word patterns and/or word families to decode words.
Match vowel and consonant sounds to all letters; identify initial and final sounds in single-syllable words.
Use word patterns and/or word families to decode words.
Use knowledge of vowel digraphs, diphthongs, and r-controlled letter-sound associations to read new words.
Identify initial, middle, and final sounds in single-syllable words.
Use knowledge of vowel digraphs, diphthongs, and r-controlled letter-sound association to read new words.
Use basic word patterns and/or word families to decode words. [N/A for K]
Apply knowledge of letter-sound associations to decode regular words and recognize irregular words.
Decode Words Using Knowledge of Syllables
Repeat spoken words with one or two syllables.
Determine the number of syllables in familiar one- to three-syllable spoken words.
Identify the number of syllables in familiar spoken words.
Decode basic words of two to three syllables using knowledge of syllable types and patterns.
Identify the number of syllables in spoken words.
Decode words of two to four syllables at independent reading level using knowledge of syllable types and patterns.
Decode new words using knowledge of common onsets and rimes. [N/A for K]
Decode most grade-level multisyllabic words using knowledge of syllable types and patterns.
Decode words using knowledge of chunks or small words. [N/A for K]
Decode and Determine Meaning of Words Using Knowledge of Word Parts
Decode and determine the meaning of words using knowledge of common base words and a few simple prefixes and suffixes.
Decode and determine the meaning of words using knowledge of common roots, prefixes, and suffixes at independent reading level.
Determine meaning of words using knowledge of common root words and word parts in text at independent reading level.
Determine meaning of words using knowledge of root words and word parts in near grade-level text.
Determine meaning of words using knowledge of root words and word parts in grade-level text.
Decode and Determine Meaning of Words Using Knowledge of Word Parts
Read simple, familiar words.
Decode simple, familiar words.
Decode and determine meaning of words using knowledge of common base words and a few simple prefixes and suffixes.
Read and determine the meaning of simple, familiar words.
Decode and determine meaning of words using knowledge of common base words and a few simple prefixes and suffixes.
Decode and determine meaning of words using knowledge of common roots, prefixes, and suffixes in brief, simple text.
Decode and determine the meaning of words by using common inflectional endings (e.g., -ed, -ing, and plural -s). [N/A for K]
Decode and determine meaning of words using knowledge of common roots, prefixes, and suffixes at independent reading level.
Apply common root words, prefixes, and suffixes, to decode and determine meaning of words in text at independent reading level.
Decode and determine meaning of words using knowledge of common base words and simple prefixes and suffixes. [N/A for K]
Decode and determine meaning of most words using knowledge of common roots, prefixes, and suffixes near grade level.
Apply root words, prefixes, and suffixes, including some Greek and Latin derivatives, to decode and determine meaning of some complex words in near grade-level text.
Decode and determine meaning of words using knowledge of common base words and simple prefixes, suffixes, and contractions. [N/A for K]
Decode and determine meaning of words using knowledge of various roots, prefixes, and suffixes at grade level.
Apply root words, prefixes, and suffixes, including Greek and Latin derivatives, to decode and determine meaning of complex words in grade-level text.
Use Context to Determine Meaning of Words
Identify the meaning of familiar words.
Identify the meaning of some unfamiliar words using context in text at independent reading level.
Identify the meaning of unfamiliar words and words with multiple meanings using context in text at independent reading level.
Identify the meaning of unfamiliar words and words with multiple meanings using context in near grade-level text.
Determine the meaning of unfamiliar words and words with multiple meanings using context in grade-level text.
Identify and Use Synonyms, Antonyms, Homonyms
Identify common, simple antonym pairs (e.g., hot/cold).
Identify common, simple antonyms and synonyms.
Identify common antonyms, synonyms, and homonyms. [N/A for K]
Identify and use common antonyms and synonyms to determine the meaning of words. [N/A for K]
Identify and use synonyms, antonyms, and homonyms to determine the meaning of words. [N/A for K]
Identify and Use Synonyms, Antonyms, Homonyms, and Words with Multiple Meanings
Identify common, simple antonym pairs (e.g., hot/cold).
Identify common, simple antonyms and synonyms.
Identify and use common synonyms, antonyms, homonyms, and words with multiple meanings at independent reading level.
Identify and use synonyms, antonyms, homonyms, and words with multiple meanings at grade level.
Identify and Use Synonyms, Antonyms, and Words With Multiple Meanings
Identify common, simple antonym pairs (e.g., hot/cold).
Identify common antonyms and synonyms and some words with multiple meanings.
Apply context to identify the meaning of unfamiliar words and words with multiple meanings in text at independent reading level.
Explain relationships among words including connotation and denotation, antonyms, synonyms, and words with multiple meanings in near grade-level text.
Explain relationships among words including connotation and denotation, antonyms, synonyms, and words with multiple meanings in grade-level text.
Read With Fluency
Read a few familiar, high frequency words fluently.
Read sight words and other familiar words and phrases accurately.
Read familiar high frequency words fluently.
Read simple sentences with familiar vocabulary with fluency and accuracy appropriate to reading level.
Read regular and irregular sight words fluently.
Read text at independent reading level with fluency and accuracy appropriate to reading level.
Read grade-level text at near grade-level fluency. [N/A for K]
Read grade-level text with fluency and accuracy near grade level.
Read near grade-level text with fluency and accuracy.
Read grade-level text at grade-level fluency. [N/A for K]
Read grade-level text with fluency and accuracy at grade level.
Read grade-level text with fluency and accuracy.
ELD Goal 3.2: Reading Comprehension
Follow Written Directions
Follow one-step written directions represented by signs, symbols, and one or two words.
Follow written directions represented by signs, symbols, and one or two words.
Follow simple one- and two-step written directions.
Follow simple one-step written directions supported by visual clues.
Follow simple two-step written directions.
Follow some simple multi-step written directions.
Follow simple multi-step written directions.
Follow simple one-step written directions.
Follow some simple multi-step written directions.
Follow simple multi-step written directions.
Follow multi-step written directions.
Follow complex one-step written directions. [N/A for K]
Follow simple multi-step written directions.
Follow multi-step written directions.
Follow written procedures in informational text and identify the main purpose.
Follow two-step written directions. [N/A for K]
Follow multi-step written directions.
Follow written procedures in informational text and identify the main purpose.
Identify Topic in Text
Identify the topic in brief text with illustrations by drawing a picture or using gestures or words orally.
Identify orally the topic in brief text with illustrations by drawing a picture and using phrases.
Identify orally the topic in text with illustrations by using simple sentences.
Identify the topic in near grade-level text and sequence information in a logical order. [N/A for K]
Identify the topic in grade-level text and sequence information in a logical order. [N/A for K]
Describe Main Idea in Text
Identify orally some facts in simple text with visuals read aloud.
Identify orally the main idea in brief text read aloud with visuals.
Identify orally the main idea in brief, simple text with visuals.
Identify orally facts in brief text read with support and retell facts in logical order.
Identify orally the main idea and some supporting details in brief text with visuals read with support.
Identify the main idea and some supporting details in brief text with visuals using expanded sentences.
Identify main ideas in text at independent reading level and retell important information from the text.
Summarize the literal or inferential main idea and some critical details from text at independent reading level.
Identify a theme or thesis and supporting evidence in text at independent reading level.
Identify main ideas and summarize important information in text near grade-level.
Summarize the literal and inferential main ideas and critical details from near grade-level text.
Critique a universal theme or a thesis in near grade-level texts and provide supporting evidence from each work.
Identify main ideas and summarize information in grade-level text.
Summarize the literal and inferential main ideas and critical details from grade-level text.
Analyze a universal theme or a thesis and arguments in grade-level texts.
Describe Characters, Settings, and Plots
Identify the characters and main event of a story with picture clues, using gestures or words in response to prompting.
Identify the characters, setting, and main event of a story with picture clues, using words or phrases orally in response to prompting.
Identify the characters, setting, and beginning, middle, and end of a story with picture clues, using simple sentences orally in response to prompting.
Identify and describe the characters, identify the setting, and retell the basic plot in a story.
Draw Conclusions Based on Text
Draw conclusions orally based on brief, simple text read aloud with visuals.
Draw conclusions orally based on brief, simple text with visuals on a familiar topic.
Draw conclusions based on text with visuals at independent reading level, and locate some evidence in the text.
Draw conclusions based on text near grade level and locate evidence in the text.
Draw conclusions based on grade-level text and locate evidence in the text.
Make Inferences and Draw Conclusions Based on Text
Draw conclusions orally based on brief, simple text read aloud with visuals.
Draw conclusions from brief, simple texts with visuals on a familiar topic.
Draw conclusions orally based on brief, simple text with visuals on a familiar topic.
Draw conclusions from several brief, simple texts with visuals.
Make inferences, draw conclusions, and locate some evidence in brief text at the independent reading level.
Synthesize content from several sources on a single issue and identify similar themes in texts at independent reading level.
Make inferences, draw conclusions, form opinions, and locate evidence in text near grade level.
Compare and contrast ideas and themes from several sources in near grade-level texts.
Make inferences, draw conclusions, form opinions, and locate evidence in grade-level text.
Compare and contrast ideas and themes in grade-level texts and explain how the historical or cultural context influenced each author's point of view.
Describe Characters, Settings, and Plots
Identify orally the main characters and basic sequence of events in simple stories read aloud with visuals.
Identify orally the main characters, setting, and sequence of events, after reading simple stories with visuals and other support.
Describe basic aspects of characters, setting, and plot in stories with visuals at independent reading level.
Describe detailed aspects of characters, setting, and plot in stories near grade level.
Describe detailed aspects of characters, setting, and plot in stories at grade level.
Analyze Characters, Settings, and Plots
Identify orally the main characters and basic sequence of events in simple stories read aloud with visuals.
Describe orally the main characters, setting, and sequence of events in simple stories with visuals.
Describe the main characters, setting, and sequence of events in simple stories with visuals.
Analyze basic aspects of characters, setting, and plot in stories with visuals at independent reading level.
Analyze basic aspects of characters in stories at independent reading level.
Analyze characterization, setting, and plot development in near grade-level text.
Analyze characterization, choice of narrator, and plot in near grade-level text.
Analyze characterization, setting, and plot development in grade-level text.
Analyze characterization, plot, choice of narrator, and credibility in grade-level text.
ELD Goal 4.1: Writing Process
Plan, Write, Revise, and Edit a Draft
Draw a picture for a given topic.
Draw pictures or complete a graphic organizer to show ideas for a narrative.
Draw a sequence of pictures or complete a graphic organizer to show ideas for a narrative.
Draw and label a sequence of pictures or complete a graphic organizer to show ideas for a narrative.
Label a series of pictures or fill in a simple prewriting organizer for a given topic with support, using familiar words and phrases.
Complete a graphic organizer to show ideas for a narrative; write a series of short sentences; and use a simple editing checklist of very basic rules with support.
Fill in a prewriting organizer, and, with support, write a draft of a few simple sentences that includes a main idea; edit the draft for beginning capitalization and ending punctuation. [N/A for K]
Organize a central idea and some supporting details; write a brief paragraph and revise for meaning; and use a simple editing checklist of basic rules.
Organize a central idea and some supporting details; write a brief paragraph; revise for meaning; and use a simple editing checklist of basic rules.
Fill in a prewriting organizer, write a draft that includes a main idea and some details, make basic revisions, and edit the draft for some writing conventions. [N/A for K]
Apply the writing process to: organize more complex ideas and supporting details; write a draft and revise for meaning and clarity; and use a modified grade-level editing checklist.
Apply the writing process to: organize more complex ideas and supporting details; write a draft; revise for meaning and clarity; and use a modified grade-level editing checklist.
Identify prewriting strategies and format; write and revise a draft that includes a main idea and details, and edit the draft for grade-level writing conventions. [N/A for K]
Apply the writing process to: organize ideas and select an appropriate format; write a draft and revise for meaning and clarity; and use a grade-level editing checklist.
Apply the writing process to: organize ideas and select an appropriate format; write a draft; revise for meaning and clarity; and use a grade-level editing checklist.
ELD Goal 4.2: Writing Applications
Write Narratives
Draw a picture and respond to oral prompts using gestures or words.
Dictate simple sentences for the beginning, middle, and end of a narrative.
Write simple sentences using sentence frames for the beginning, middle, and end of a narrative.
Draw and label a series of pictures and respond to oral prompts using words and phrases.
Write simple sentences with support for the beginning, middle, and end of a narrative.
Write a series of simple sentences using sentence frames for a narrative that has a beginning, middle, and end.
Write brief narratives based on personal experiences, using a sentence starter template with prompting.
Write short narratives with support that have a beginning, middle, and end.
Write a short narrative with increasingly complex sentences that develops a standard plot line, aided by a template.
Write a short narrative with increasingly complex sentences that describes specific actions and feelings of the characters, aided by a template.
Write narratives based on personal experiences that contain a main idea, using a few simple sentences. [N/A for K]
Write short narratives that have a beginning, middle, and end, using increasingly complex sentences.
Write longer narratives about personal events or situations.
Write longer autobiographical or biographical narratives that describe details of characters and changes in time and mood.
Write narratives based on personal experiences that contain a main idea, using more detailed sentences. [N/A for K]
Write short narratives with a beginning, middle, and end, using detailed sentences.
Write full-length narratives about specific events or situations including some precise details.
Write full-length fictional, autobiographical, or biographical narratives that include specific details; write reflective compositions that compare specific incidents to a broad theme about life.
Write Reports
Draw and label a picture and respond to oral prompts about observations of real objects, persons, places, events, or processes using words or phrases.
Dictate simple expository sentences.
Write simple expository sentences using sentence frames.
Draw and label a series of pictures and respond to oral prompts about observations of real objects, persons, places, events, or processes using phrases.
Write simple expository sentences with support.
Write a series of simple sentences using sentence frames that include some facts and details.
Write brief explanations of observations of real objects, persons, places, events, or processes using a sentence starter template with prompting. [N/A for K]
Write expository paragraphs with support that include a main idea and some supporting details, using simple sentences.
Write a brief research report with increasingly complex sentences that includes facts, details, and examples, aided by a template.
Write brief explanations of observations of real objects, persons, places, events, or processes, using a few simple sentences. [N/A for K]
Write brief reports that include a main idea and supporting details, using increasingly complex sentences.
Write a longer research report focused on a main idea with some important details and examples from multiple sources.
Write brief explanations of observations of real objects, persons, places, events, or processes, using more detailed sentences. [N/A for K]
Write reports that include a main idea and supporting details, using detailed sentences.
Write a full-length research report focused on a main idea with supporting details compiled through a formal research process.
Write Research Reports
Write simple expository sentences using sentence frames.
Write a series of simple sentences using sentence frames that include a basic thesis and some facts and details.
Write a brief research report with increasingly complex sentences that includes a thesis, provides relevant support, and documents sources, aided by a template.
Write a longer research report that includes a thesis, provides relevant support, and includes citations.
Write a full-length research report that states a thesis, explains the significance of specific data, facts, and ideas, and includes citations.
ELD Goal 4.3: Writing Conventions
Spell Words Correctly
Copy name and high-frequency words with some accuracy.
Copy high-frequency words and use inventive spelling for some words.
Spell many one-syllable, familiar words correctly.
Spell name and a few high-frequency words correctly and start to use invented spelling for other words.
Spell many one-syllable, high-frequency words correctly.
Spell familiar words correctly.
Spell some high-frequency words correctly and use invented spelling for other words.
Spell correctly one-syllable words with blends, contractions, and compounds, and use reference tools to correct errors.
Apply spelling rules to spell correctly words from text at the independent reading level, and independently use reference tools to correct spelling.
Spell high-frequency words correctly. [N/A for K]
Spell most grade-appropriate words correctly, and independently use reference tools to correct spelling.
Apply spelling rules and some Greek and Latin derivatives to correctly spell multisyllabic words near grade level, and independently use reference tools to correct spelling.
Spell high-frequency words correctly and apply basic spelling rules to spell other words. [N/A for K]
Consistently spell grade-appropriate words correctly, and independently use reference tools to correct spelling.
Apply spelling rules and Greek and Latin derivatives to correctly spell multisyllabic words at grade level, and independently use reference tools to correct spelling.
Apply Capitalization and Punctuation Rules
Copy familiar words, including words with capital letters.
Use capital letters in first name and other familiar proper nouns.
Use a capital letter for the first word of a sentence, familiar proper nouns, and the pronoun I; use a period at the end of a sentence. [N/A for K]
Use grade-level capitalization and punctuation rules with some errors. [N/A for K]
Use grade-level capitalization and punctuation rules with few errors. [N/A for K]
Write a Variety of Sentence Types
Identify and write very simple declarative sentences.
Identify and write simple declarative, exclamatory, and interrogative sentences.
Identify and write sentences of varying types and increasing complexity.
Identify and write sentences of varying types and complexity near grade level.
Identify and write sentences of varying types and complexity at grade level.
Identify and write sentences of varying types and complexity at grade level.
Use Grammatical Forms
Complete simple familiar Cloze sentences with a noun or verb.
Complete simple sentence frames and identify nouns and verbs with prompting.
Identify and use nouns and verbs in simple sentences. [N/A for K]
Identify and use subject-verb-object order in very simple sentences with some errors. [N/A for K]
Identify and use subject-verb-object order and subject-verb agreement in simple sentences with few errors. [N/A for K]
Apply Capitalization and Punctuation Rules
Identify and apply basic capitalization and punctuation rules for proper nouns and very simple sentences.
Identify and apply basic capitalization and punctuation rules in simple sentences.
Identify and apply basic capitalization and punctuation rules in simple sentences.
Identify and apply increasingly complex capitalization and punctuation rules.
Identify and apply increasingly complex capitalization and punctuation rules.
Identify and apply grade-level capitalization and punctuation rules with some errors.
Identify and apply grade-level capitalization and punctuation rules with some errors.
Identify and apply grade-level capitalization and punctuation rules.
Identify and apply grade-level capitalization and punctuation rules with few errors.
Use Grammatical Forms
Identify nouns and verbs in very simple sentences.
Identify nouns, verbs, and adjectives in very simple sentences.
Identify and use subject-verb-object order in very simple sentences.
